task.summary: Default task

Add EVAT credentials, Location master, and related changes
Added a new functionality to create, view and manage EVAT credentials from the dashboard. This includes a new HTML template (evat-keys.html) for displaying and managing EVAT keys in the dashboard, and another template update (loc_master.html) to handle changes in the Locations Master section. Additionally, updated 5 Python files (admin_api.py, views.py, models.py, urls.py, and admin_panel/urls.py) to handle new functionalities at the backend like - saving and viewing EVAT credentials, creating and storing new location, change evat_engine, delete location, etc. Also updated the navigation menu in base.html for easier access to the new functionalities.
This is crucial for providing the users with a much easier and convenient way of managing their EVAT keys and Locations from the dashboard on the go, without having to deal with the back-end complexities. Each EVAT credential includes server information, company details and keys for various services.

Update file upload paths in migrations
Updated file upload path in 'appscenter' migrations from 0084 to 0091. This change is necessary to be up-to-date with the file upload time and also to ensure that files uploaded do not overwrite each other. Additionally, added initial migrations for the 'reports' app for proper version control and replicate the application state across different environments.

Corrected 'entry' value in cmms_api data dict
Fixed the 'entry' field in the data dictionary to correctly reference the 'ref' attribute of the 'frozen' object, not the non-existent 'ent()' method. This change is necessary for maintaining correct information when retrieving data from the 'frozen' object.

Update filename in CSV export for STC document
The filename of the exported CSV in the case of a STC document now includes the reference number (ref) of the associated header. Previously, the filename only contained the location ID and remarks of the header. With the addition of the reference number, it will be easier to identify the corresponding header for each exported CSV file.

Add 'Others' option to position dropdown
This commit adds a new option, 'Others', to the position dropdown in the sales-customer.html template. This allows users to select a different position that is not listed in the predefined options. This increases the flexibility of the form.

Refactor 'save_sales_customer' to include company validation
This commit refactors the 'save_sales_customer' view method to include validation for company. A check is added to see whether a customer from the respective company already exists. This change is necessary to prevent duplicate entries of the same company in the sales customer database.

Add functionality to close sales deals via API
This commit introduces the ability to close sales deals through the API. The update in the deal's status is indicated in the transaction record of the deal. The implemented changes influence multiple parts of the code, including the HTML representation of deals in 'sales-cust.html', the JS functions in 'anton.js' and 'cmms_cust.js' and most importantly, the backend logic in 'cmms_api.py' where the actual closing of deals is carried out. This feature helps sales reps to finalize their deals and record the closing remarks, improving the overall management of sales in the platform.
Updated tasks to have a scroll on full
Updated tasks to have a scroll on full
Integrating retail
Integrating retail
Auto generate user id and password
Auto generate user id and password
increase pword size
pword changed to text field
Update report.js to make sure cmms sales customer reports are accurate

Update CMMS routing

MESSAGE.value:
Add EVAT credentials, Location master, and related changes
Added a new functionality to create, view and manage EVAT credentials from the dashboard. This includes a new HTML template (evat-keys.html) for displaying and managing EVAT keys in the dashboard, and another template update (loc_master.html) to handle changes in the Locations Master section. Additionally, updated 5 Python files (admin_api.py, views.py, models.py, urls.py, and admin_panel/urls.py) to handle new functionalities at the backend like - saving and viewing EVAT credentials, creating and storing new location, change evat_engine, delete location, etc. Also updated the navigation menu in base.html for easier access to the new functionalities.
This is crucial for providing the users with a much easier and convenient way of managing their EVAT keys and Locations from the dashboard on the go, without having to deal with the back-end complexities. Each EVAT credential includes server information, company details and keys for various services.

Update file upload paths in migrations
Updated file upload path in 'appscenter' migrations from 0084 to 0091. This change is necessary to be up-to-date with the file upload time and also to ensure that files uploaded do not overwrite each other. Additionally, added initial migrations for the 'reports' app for proper version control and replicate the application state across different environments.

Corrected 'entry' value in cmms_api data dict
Fixed the 'entry' field in the data dictionary to correctly reference the 'ref' attribute of the 'frozen' object, not the non-existent 'ent()' method. This change is necessary for maintaining correct information when retrieving data from the 'frozen' object.

Update filename in CSV export for STC document
The filename of the exported CSV in the case of a STC document now includes the reference number (ref) of the associated header. Previously, the filename only contained the location ID and remarks of the header. With the addition of the reference number, it will be easier to identify the corresponding header for each exported CSV file.

Add 'Others' option to position dropdown
This commit adds a new option, 'Others', to the position dropdown in the sales-customer.html template. This allows users to select a different position that is not listed in the predefined options. This increases the flexibility of the form.

Refactor 'save_sales_customer' to include company validation
This commit refactors the 'save_sales_customer' view method to include validation for company. A check is added to see whether a customer from the respective company already exists. This change is necessary to prevent duplicate entries of the same company in the sales customer database.

Add functionality to close sales deals via API
This commit introduces the ability to close sales deals through the API. The update in the deal's status is indicated in the transaction record of the deal. The implemented changes influence multiple parts of the code, including the HTML representation of deals in 'sales-cust.html', the JS functions in 'anton.js' and 'cmms_cust.js' and most importantly, the backend logic in 'cmms_api.py' where the actual closing of deals is carried out. This feature helps sales reps to finalize their deals and record the closing remarks, improving the overall management of sales in the platform.
